```{r}
library(recommenderlab)
library(tidyverse)
```


# Import Data

```{r}
health_product_holding_final <- readRDS("../../product_holding/health_product_holding_final.rds") %>% 
  mutate(ACCOUNT_NO = as.character(ACCOUNT_NO))
gi_product_holding_final <- readRDS("../../product_holding/gi_product_holding_final.rds")
```

# Check number of products & NAs

```{r}
health_product_holding_final %>% 
  count(Product)

gi_product_holding_final %>% 
  count(POLICY_TYPE)
```


# Renaming of columns

```{r}
health_product_holding_final %>% 
  rename(PRODUCT = Product) -> health_product_holding_final

gi_product_holding_final %>% 
  rename(PRODUCT = POLICY_TYPE) -> gi_product_holding_final
```


# Merge the tables

```{r}
products_df_raw <-
bind_rows(
  health_product_holding_final,
  gi_product_holding_final
)

dim(products_df_raw)
head(products_df_raw)
```
# Overall product holding

On average, people purchase just one product.

```{r}
products_df_raw %>% 
  count(ACCOUNT_NO) %>% 
  summary()
```

```{r}
purchase_dist <-
products_df_raw %>% 
  count(ACCOUNT_NO) %>% 
  mutate(n = pmin(5, n)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(n))+
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.5)+
  scale_y_log10(labels = scales::comma_format())+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1,5,1),
                     labels = c(seq(1,4,1),"+5"))+
  stat_bin(binwidth=1, geom="text", aes(label=..count..), vjust=0.25)+
  labs(title = "Distribution of product purchases",
       subtitle = "Most customers purchase just one product",
       x = "Purchases",
       y = "Purchase Frequency")

purchase_dist
```


# Create dummy variables

```{r}
products_df <-
products_df_raw %>% 
  pivot_wider(names_from = PRODUCT, 
              values_from = n, 
              values_fill = 0,
              values_fn = length)

dim(products_df)
head(products_df)
```


# Missing account numbers

```{r}
setdiff(x = health_product_holding_final$ACCOUNT_NO, 
        y = products_df$ACCOUNT_NO)

setdiff(x = gi_product_holding_final$ACCOUNT_NO, 
        y = products_df$ACCOUNT_NO)
```


# Convert to matrix

```{r}
products_matrix <-
products_df %>% 
  select(-ACCOUNT_NO) %>% 
  as.matrix()

rownames(products_matrix) <- products_df %>% pull(ACCOUNT_NO)
```

# Check matrix

```{r}
rownames(products_matrix)[1:10]
colnames(products_matrix)[1:10]
```

# Convert to binaryRatingMatrix

```{r}
products_rating_matrix <- as(products_matrix, "binaryRatingMatrix")
```


```{r}
class(products_rating_matrix)
```
